channel.title: OpenSuSE 10.2 boot issue
channel.description:
First off,You should know i installed opensuse on a 320GB external USB hard drive, so i just switch BIOS boot order to load off the usb device. Whenever i boot into opensuse, for the most part it loads fine, but i get annoying messages halfway through. i cant remember the exact message but itll show ata_piix and underneath ata1 and a bunch of errors for a minute, then it'll show SCSI and then ata2 errors for a minute, i can remember bits of the error, it said something like wait 30 seconds, soft reset failed, status 0xff. After that's over it boots perfectly. Does anyone know why im getting these messages? could it be a bad hard disk configuration?
Thanks, Nick

item.title: OpenSuSE 10.2 boot issue
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Do you have any problems running the system? Some error or warning messages are quite normal and don’t cause any problems.

Read full topic

item.title: OpenSuSE 10.2 boot issue
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

We really would need the full error message. With half an error message, maybe somebody who has experienced the same problem can help, but with the full one, somebody who knows a bit about linux might be able to figure it out, even if they’ve never seen the problem.

Full error messages, folks, always.

Read full topic

item.title: OpenSuSE 10.2 boot issue
